events.message: The insured reported a vehicle collision that occurred on April 30th, requesting an official claim submission for damages to the car.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under 'Auto Accident' based on the description of the vehicle collision provided by the customer.
An insurance agent specialized in auto claims was assigned to handle the customer's case to facilitate a smooth process.
The customer received confirmation that their auto accident claim has been acknowledged and is now under review.
The agent requested relevant documentation including police reports, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates.
The customer submitted all requested documents, including the accident report, vehicle damage photos, and the tow service receipt.
The claims department began investigating the incident to verify the circumstances of the auto collision and assess damage.
The investigation concluded confirming the claimant was not at fault and the documentation supports the reported damages.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover the full cost of repairs and additional rental vehicle expenses during the repair period.
The customer responded positively to the settlement proposal, expressing satisfaction with the proposed coverage and service.
The insurance claim was officially approved following acceptance of the settlement offer and completion of all formalities.
Payment was issued to the repair shop and rental car provider in accordance with the approved settlement for the vehicle damages.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after confirmation that repairs were completed and all payments were received.
All documentation and communication related to the auto accident claim were archived for future reference and compliance purposes.
